Title.En: Shaping the Future of District Heating

Description.En:
“Vilniaus šilumos tinklai” is one of the largest district heating companies in the Baltic States. The company’s customers are the residents of Vilnius, and every day, services are provided to nearly 220,000 Vilnius clients, heating almost 7,500 buildings. We not only provide heat to the city’s residents but also heat for hot tap water. The consumption of hot water during the day has its peaks and managing them is crucial whole year. A sudden increase in hot water usage places a heavy load on the production chain, which also needs to maintain the temperature required for heating. While managing this is a technical necessity, it also impacts customer satisfaction, energy efficiency, and the broader goals of sustainability.  

What possible solutions, using technologies or other means, could help manage consumption peaks and minimize their impact?  

We aim to discover innovative, actionable solutions to manage hot water consumption peaks more effectively and minimize their impact on our production chain. These solutions may include technological innovations, smart systems, or creative non-technical approaches.  

The energy sector is a field where technological advancement and innovation intersect with sustainability and purpose. The solutions implemented in the sector not only affect companies as economic entities but also have a significant impact on customers satisfaction and the overall goal of sustainability and a cleaner world.  

This is more than just a challenge—it’s a chance to solve a real-world problem for one of the largest district heating companies in the Baltic States. By participating, you’ll gain valuable experience in tackling complex issues, working with industry-relevant scenarios, and contributing to meaningful solutions that can shape the future of energy management.

Title.En: Create and present ideas and prototypes

NoteLiteral.En: Create and effectively present innovative ideas and developed prototypes tailored to the requirements of unique audience.

PrefLabel.En: evaluate data, information and digital content

NoteLiteral.En: Self-sufficiently pinpoint a unique and impactful research direction, utilizing existing knowledge and acquired competencies.
Innovatively tackle complex real-world issues using the core tenets of challenge-based learning methodology.
Utilise effective teamwork and leadership principles while collaborating within diverse, interdisciplinary teams.

Title.En: Shaping the Future of District Heating
Shaping the Future of District Heating

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
[Syllabus](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=INNOM010&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=) of the micro-module.

The challenge will be solved in the module „**Development of Challenge-Based Innovation**“ (6 ECTS, online meetings – 32 hours, individual and group work – 128 hours). The module follows the challenge-based learning method: engagement, inspiration, investigation, and action.  

The challenge will be delivered in the KTU virtual learning environment. When a student is enrolled in KTU, s/he will be informed by email on how to gain access to the challenge.  

The challenge will take place **from March 6 to May 29, 2025**. The scheduled meetings with the teamchers and the peer learners will be held**once a week on Thursdays**: March 6, 13, 20, 27; April 10, 17, 24; May 8, 22, 29. The meetings will be held **at 15.30-17.00/18.30 EET**  (depending on the day). Please note that attendance is mandatory and highly appreciated by your team members.

The learners are supported by the KTU teamchers (faculty) and the partner company Vilniaus šilumos tinklai. The learner teams are presented with the challenge during the kick-off meeting, they are invited to do an interim presentation on the progress of their project in the middle of the module and the final presentation of the shallenge solution at the last meeting of the module. The final grade is passed/failed.

After the successful completion of the challenge:

- In two weeks, a student will receive an email with the link to download the ECIU University micro-credential.
- In mid-June 2025, a student from other university than KTU will receive an email with the KTU Transcript of Records that might be presented for recognition of learning outcomes at the home university.
How to manage short-term consumption peaks using available technological innovations?

In the rapidly evolving world of energy and district heating, managing short-term consumption peaks remains a significant challenge. Vilniaus Šilumos Tinklai, a leader in the industry, is spearheading this challenge to drive efficiency and sustainability. Your task is to tackle the real-world problem of optimizing peak hot water consumption, which is crucial for enhancing operational stability.

Vilniaus Šilumos Tinklai is seeking innovative and practical solutions to effectively manage and minimize the impact of hot water consumption peaks. This could involve developing new technologies, implementing smart systems, or even devising creative non-technical strategies. Your goal is to find actionable ways to smooth out these peaks to enhance the stability and efficiency of our heating services.

Your ideas have the potential to improve industry practices and contribute to more sustainable energy consumption patterns. Engage directly with a challenge that affects the efficiency of energy systems worldwide. Enhance your problem-solving, creativity, and technical skills in a real-world context.

Embrace this opportunity to make a tangible impact on the energy sector with your innovative solutions. Let's work together to transform challenges into opportunities and pave the way for a more efficient future.
